message_1: Find the smallest positive integer x that satisfies the equation 3^x ≡ 2 (mod 17).
message_2:
To find the smallest positive integer x that satisfies the equation 3^x ≡ 2 (mod 17), we can use the method of successive powers. We will calculate the powers of 3 modulo 17 until we find a power that is congruent to 2 modulo 17.

3^1 ≡ 3 (mod 17)
3^2 ≡ 9 (mod 17)
3^3 ≡ 27 ≡ 10 (mod 17)
3^4 ≡ 81 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
3^5 ≡ 243 ≡ 5 (mod 17)

3^10 ≡ 59049 ≡ 18 ≡ 1 (mod 17)
3^11 ≡ 177147 ≡ 3 (mod 17)
3^12 ≡ 531441 ≡ 9 (mod 17)

3^18 ≡ 387420489 ≡ 12 (mod 17)

3^20 ≡ 3486784401 ≡ 1 (mod 17)

We can see that 3^20 ≡ 1 (mod 17), which means that the powers of 3 will start repeating after this point. Since we have not found a power of 3 that is congruent to 2 modulo 17, there is no smallest positive integer x that satisfies the equation 3^x ≡ 2 (mod 17).
